body.p: To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin Govr of the State of Kentucky --

The undersigned Jurors who tried the Indictment against G. C. Moody at the present term of the Campbell Circuit Court on a charge of sending a challenge to fight a duel, state that they ^were^ constrained by the evidence and the instructions to find a verdict of guilty and that they assessed the lowest penalty known to the law- a fine of $500.00/100 --

They would, under the circumstances, had the law permitted, have made the fine merely nominal. They believe the said G. C. Moody is a fit subject for Executive clemency and they therefore recommend your Excellency to remit the fine against him believing the amount he will be compelled to pay the Attorny for the Commonwealth & the costs will be ample punishment for the offence

Wm Robson
John Taylor
W,, W,, Brown
T L Richerson
J B Waggener
William Marsh
Henry Osterhause
E. G. Smith
Edw Jos Hooper
Thomas Survan
Hendrik Klekamp
W. R. Taliaferro

I Jno Artsman clerk of the Campbell Circuit Court do certify that Tho. Richardson, Wm W. Brown, Jno Taylor, I. B. Wagner, E. J. Smith, Wm Robson, Wm Marsh, E J. Hooper, H. Oberhouse, Wm R Taliaferro, H. Klekamp & Thomas Survan were are the Jurors who tried the case mentioned in the petition which their signatures appear & that I believe their signatures genuine Feby 20/62

Remitted
B M
Campbell Cir. Ct
$500 } Sending a challenge
Please send answer to J. R. Hallam Newport Ky
G. C. Moody
Issd Feby 21. 1862
